on Wednesday Egypt's former president
hosni mubarek goes on trial facing
charges of corruption and ordering the

dominated the headlines in Egypt today
that's the trial of President Hosni
Mubarak there's due to appear in court
tomorrow it's a moment that Egyptians
have long awaited since the overthrow of
President Mubarak the revolution that
culminated in February with
demonstrations of hundreds of thousands
of people in Tigers square his trial
comes at a tense moment any Egypt where
the revolution is unresolved and
conflicting forces of salt leverage and
trying to determine its outcome the
country has been ruled by military

widespread perception that it's

is a seminal moment in the country in

Middle East rarely if ever as a

some comparisons might be made to Saddam

this is a far different spectacle it's

mr. mobotix trials a sign of things that
could come for them as well in some ways

and to the successor in Egypt that the

long and as Somalia faces its worst

photographer for the new york times and
i just returned from Mogadishu Somalia
where I was covering the famine that's
really had a hard impact on the civilian
population the condition for these
people is so bad that they're actually
streaming into Mogadishu a city that is
one of the most dangerous in the entire
world where there's active fighting
going on it says something about the
condition of where they're coming from
despite the conditions these people are
living under there's a surprising
responsiveness and understanding of
having a camera in front of them how
photograph taken I really encountered
very little objection from the people
because really they've come there for
help and they in some way see the camera
as a way of getting their condition
shown in the outside world particularly
the children are the ones that have been
affected the most by this famine at
times I saw some these children and I
couldn't even tell if they were dead or
alive but they were just so incredibly
sick or vomiting completely dehydrated
malnourished the flies were just
relentless people are so poor in fact
the family didn't even have enough money
to buy mosquito nets there's one

child very skinny very sick under this
sheen of multi colored scarf kind of see
through to the face it was just very
difficult to see some of these scenes
I've covered a lot of issues in Africa
